intro: Haplopappus ochagavianus, commonly known as the Chilean dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Haplopappus ochagavianus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
